title: Has anyone tried and been successful getting out of a cell phone contract with no early termination fees? If so, how did you do it? - Quora

response.answer_text: 2 ways I got out of a contract in the past, so here they are: Planned to move outside of their coverage area. Keep at the scare tactic and ensure it will occur in 2 months. So unless they can provide coverage I'll need to change carriers.If you've got a really good plan like I did, either give it away for free, have a friend or familyMehmet take it over, or put it up for sale. Years ago the Fido CityFido $45/mth plans were being sold for up to $1500 until they stopped allowing the transfers of only these plans.Now that's how to stick it to them!

I sold cell phones for most of my career. The easiest way out was in the 30 days following an adverse change made to the terms and conditions. Unfortunately this doesn't happen very often. If you can show a documented history of service issues sometimes people are able to get out. If you move outside of the carrier's service area or out of the country. If you get called up to active duty military service or deployed overseas. Also, as far as I know T-Mobile is still buying people out of their contracts..
